{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, the adrenal gland in females secretes DHEA (Dehydroepiandrosterone). Document [1] states that the fetal zone of the adrenal gland produces large amounts of adrenal androgens, including DHEA, which are used by the placenta for estrogen biosynthesis. Document [15] also mentions that the zona reticularis, which is part of the adrenal cortex, produces androgens that are converted to fully functional sex hormones in the gonads and other target organs. Therefore, the correct answer is D. DHEA.", "answer_choice": "D"}
